forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain showers before 2am. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 61. Southwest wind around 5 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Thursday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 68, with temperatures falling to around 65 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 5 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 20 mph.

weather_report:
As we drift into the night in Downtown San Francisco, the air is tinged with the promise of a gentle rain that may brush against the city before dawn. Currently, the skies are dominated by a soft blanket of clouds, hardly veiling the stars above, with temperatures resting comfortably in the low sixties. A mild southwest breeze whispers through the streets, adding a touch of chill to the moist air, hinting at the slight chance of rain — a company of droplets that may or may not greet you. 

Come Thursday, expect the sun to shake off the remnants of the night, revealing a mostly bright day. The temperatures will dance between the mid and low sixties, presenting a pleasant warmth for afternoon strolls. However, you might still encounter the lingering essence of fog as it retreats, leaving behind a clarity that inspires outdoor pursuits. Ideal attire would be layers, perhaps a light sweater to keep the evening chill at bay without compromising your comfort during the day. With such moderate conditions, a leisurely visit to Golden Gate Park or an afternoon of exploration in the vibrant streets of the Mission would be a delightful way to savor the beauty of the city and its ever-changing skies.
